ranked_diseases.explanation: Perfect match with reference cases showing identical immunological profile: decreased CD4:CD8 ratio, B lymphocytopenia, decreased memory B cells, low IgA and IgM. All three reference cases had this diagnosis with similar presentations.
Another CVID subtype that presents with B cell defects, hypogammaglobulinemia, and can have associated thrombocytopenia. The immunological profile matches but specific genetic variant differs.
CVID subtype with B lymphocytopenia, decreased immunoglobulins, and memory B cell defects. Can present with autoimmune manifestations including thrombocytopenia.
Classic CVID presentation with hypogammaglobulinemia, B cell abnormalities, and potential autoimmune complications. Less specific match than CVID-13.
Can present with B lymphocytopenia, decreased class-switched memory B cells, and autoimmune cytopenias including thrombocytopenia. The CD4:CD8 ratio changes support this.
Causes decreased memory B cells, hypogammaglobulinemia with low IgA and IgM, and B lymphocytopenia. However, CD4:CD8 ratio changes are less typical.
Can cause B cell defects, hypogammaglobulinemia, and immune dysregulation with cytopenias. The B cell phenotype matches but is less specific than CVID.
Presents with hypogammaglobulinemia, B cell defects, and autoimmune cytopenias including thrombocytopenia. T cell abnormalities also occur.
